intro: Merostachys sparsiflora, commonly known as the sparse-flowered grass, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the grass family (Poaceae) and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and narrow, linear leaves. The plant produces small, spike-like inflorescences with pale green to brownish flowers, which are typically arranged in a loose, open cluster. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in wetlands, along stream banks, and in disturbed areas. Merostachys sparsiflora plays a role in stabilizing soil and providing habitat for various invertebrates.
